fields.description:
The webwork Query class has a cache of previously parsed (but not executed) EL strings.

Anything that is thrown at Webwork is cached forever statically.  A memory dump reveals strings like

"com.atlassian.jira.web.action.ViewIssue@2345", "com.atlassian.jira.web.action.ViewIssue@63434", "com.atlassian.jira.web.action.ViewIssue@7373434"

These will never be re-used and the dump I saw had 145MB of these guys for JAC.

I think this cache can be killed.  Its the "parse" of the EL string into Object "segment" representation.   

My gut feel is that computationally it small yet memory wise it has a large and growing impact.

We should kill the cache or limit its size somehow.

SimpleText in webwork does the same thig but not as bad.
fields.summary: webwork Query cache is unbounded - and its putting in unbounded string
When only one more workflow option is available, don't hide it under the "Workflows" drop-down list

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to replace "Labels" for a project with custom field of type "Labels" in a slick way.

Main differences:
* The "More Actions" menu will still point to the "Labels" system field, even if you hide the field in the field scheme. That is a major drawback. 
* The "cog" icon, available in gadgets, issue navigator, etc., will also still point to the "Labels" system field.

Jira needs to provide server/project admins a facility to link (or replace) the general (system) field with a custom field of type "Labels" for every single project independently.
fields.summary: Custom field of type "Labels" is not fully replacment for the system field "Labels"

fields.description:
Currently (as for v4.3.x) "Labels" field is shared among all project on the same server/DB. There is no easy way to separate it on a project basis. Custom field of type "Labels" is lacking some features that the system "Labels" field has, such as accessibility via the "cog" icon and the "More Actions" menu.

I suggest that Jira will treat "Labels" in the same manner they do it with Components and Versions, without the need to create custom field for each project (consider server with 30 or 50 projects...)
fields.summary: Labels should be configured in the project level not on the server level
Be able to create a customized release note, like a release note for a specific component.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24600].
  {panel}

Admin Story:

"I am looking at 100 custom fields. How can I find which plugin provides the custom field type for a particular field?"

An admin would want to do this to work out how to disable a specific custom field without removing it and losing the data in it. Or they may want to work out which support organization to contact about a bug with the field.

At the moment they could grep the plugin jar files for the name of the custom field type (not always successful) or go to the database (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Database+Schema#DatabaseSchema-Customfields) and get the CUSTOMFIELDTYPEKEY (but there may even be two custom field types with the same name). Given the plugin key they need to look at the vendors for an idea or grep the plugin jar files again.

One way to provide this information to an admin would be to make the custom field type names listed at Admin, Custom Field into links to the UPM and the specific plugin module that provides the given custom field type. This would work for the standard custom field types too.
fields.summary: Input for any Admin, Custom Fields UX changes

fields.description:
Before the upgrade from 4.0.1 to 4.2.4 using Jira Labels Plugin, the following query works:

project = MB and fixVersion = "Maint 3 - May 2011 Version 2.2.2" and label not in (core_integration, android_stopgap)

This will show all the issues with the exception of the Core Integration and the Android Stop Gap work labels. The not labeled issues will be displayed as well.

After the upgrade all the tickets that had no label had also been excluded. re-wroting the query as the following:

project = mb and fixVersion = "Maint 3 - May 2011 Version 2.2.2" and (label not in (Core_Integration, Android_Stopgap) or label is EMPTY)

Then it will pull the non-labeled issues also
fields.summary: Query Issues by labels after upgrading from 4.0.1 to 4.2.4

I received an error after beginning my CSV import. I was not working from a previously saved configuration file; I selected all of my options manually. I know that JIRA was at least able to see the CSV since the example values during the import were just as expected.

I attached the entire stacktrace. For completeness, I also attached the CSV file I am trying to upload and the configuration file that was given to me from my selections.

Possibly related to JRA-7785. I feel like the CSV is not being uploaded or stored properly. I have verified that JIRA does have access to read/write to JIRA_HOME. Of course, I do not believe that to be part of the problem anyways, since I never got a "permission denied" error.

fields.description:
When installing JIRA and selecting to install a service, it installs the service with the name of "Apache Tomcat 6" now instead of naming it according to the name you specify during installation as it did previously.  I first noticed this when installing 4.3.2, and so i have 4.3.2 already installed, then i tried to install 4.3.3 in parallel and it errors during the service install with the following error:

[2011-05-13 09:52:14] [info]  Service JIRA130511095110 name Apache Tomcat 6
[2011-05-13 09:52:14] [error] The name is already in use as either a service name or a service display name.

So, i can not install multiple versions on the same server in order to test anymore.  This will also effect upgradability down the road if that is what the service is named.

I know that it is possible to install the service manually, however, it is much easier to have the windows installer install it for us.  Also, to install a service manually, it is required to have a JDK installed, and there is no other reason for us to install a JDK, so i would prefer to not install it if i don't need to.

Can this please be looked into and reverted to the previous method of installing the service used in 4.2.4 and earlier versions?  Thanks.
fields.summary: Service Name already in use during install

fields.description:
There are some instances where transition condition logic doesn't match logic used when searching/filtering.
For example, if I have a custom field, "Publishable", of type "Multi Checkboxes", whose only option is "Publishable", and I do a search for "Publishable = Publishable", I return three issues.
However, if I create a "Value Field" transition condition with the requirements that "The field Publishable will have to be equal to value Publishable . Compared like String ." then that transition doesn't show for any issue, not even the three that matched the search above.

Another example is when comparing a time field (such as originalEstimate) as a number. If I search for issues where "originalEstimate > 480", it matches all the issues where the original estimate is greater than 480 minutes (8 hours).
However, I discovered through some testing that a transition condition using the requirement that "The field Original Estimate will have to be greater than or equal to value 480. Compared like Number ." causes the transition to show for any issue with an original estimate greater than 480 SECONDS (8 minutes)!

These discrepancies make it very hard to create certain transition conditions. I like to test my conditions first using a search filter, and for the most part that works, but I published a workflow that included these and we had some unexpected results.
fields.summary: Transition condition logic does not match search/filter logic.

fields.description:
If JIRA contains legacy usernames with mixed cases such as User.Name. Error below will shown when search with query _assignee="User.Name"_  .

{quote}
The value 'User.Name' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.
{quote}

click on Assigned To Me Gadget in Dashboard will also produce the error.

!QueryError.PNG|thumbnail!


*Finding*
# This happened in Case Sensitive database. 

*Workaround*
# Upgrade to JIRA 4.3, the new User Management introduced since JIRA 4.3 will solved the problem.
# In our test, Changing database collation to Case insensitive or change to case insensitive database such as MySQL(e.g utf8_general_ci)solved the problem. But this might effect JIRA or any other database hosted on the same database server.
# Change affected usernames to lowercase by follow [changing usernames guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+Usernames+in+JIRA]
|
fields.summary: Issue Navigator Return Error when Username Contains mixed Cases

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Set up Crowd
# Add "jira" as an application in Crowd
# Set up JIRA with a remote crowd directory pointing at Crowd
# Go to User Directories
# Click "synchronise" and wait until synchronisation finishes. Look at Crowd log to make sure something is happening.
# Click "synchronise" again and look at the Crowd log.

*Expected result:*
Synchronisation request should hit Crowd

*Actual result:*
No request hits Crowd

Perhaps the best way of seeing whether the request even hits Crowd is to now remove the "jira" application from Crowd. When you refresh the User Directory page and click "synchronise" you should see in the Crowd logs something like: "Application 'jira' failed authentication".

*Workaround*
The workaround is to ensure that you always refresh the page before hitting "synchronise".
fields.summary: Synchronising a directory twice on the same page fails the second time

fields.description:
In practice, I need to create many JQL queries and save them as filters. The filters are usually very similar except for scripts. For a simple example, I need to create the following:

project="XYZ" and state = Open
project="XYZ" and state = "Under Review"
project="XYZ" and state = "In Progress"
project="XYZ" and state = Implemented
project="XYZ" and state = Closed

These filters will ultimately be displayed in a dashboard via the Filter Gadget. 

I then have to create these same filters for different states across many projects (ABC, DEF, GHI, JKL, ...)

As you can see, creating all of these manually in the issue navigator and then saving as filters takes a lot of manual time.

I'd like to be able to create all these queries and filter names in a Jelly XML structure so it can be automated much faster.
fields.summary: Ability to use Jelly script to import JQL queries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24576].
  {panel}

Currently if you type "some text" in the quick search box, it generates this jql

summary ~ "some text" OR description ~ "some text" OR comment ~ "some text"


But then this hard to quickly change and refine the search, especially if you type it in wrong (3 strings to edit and all)

It would be better of it generated

text ~ "some text"


I spoke the Brenden Bain about this and he said the reason they did it originally what that summary,description and comment where the original quick text semantics.  

But that 'text' also support custom fields and hence is semantically different.

But I argue that the benefit of "edit ability" is greater than the semantic preservation.
fields.summary: Change the quick search JQL generation to just 'text'

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24572].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 24 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Thank you for your votes and comments on this feature request and also on the linked issues.

I am happy to announce that JIRA 6.4 has implemented pagination, search and filtering by project category on Browse Projects page.

Cheers,

Eve Stankiewicz
JIRA Product Management
{panel}

*Original request description:*

Hi Atlassian,

We are currently working on a large enterprise project management system and are hoping to make JIRA a core component of this system. We envision that JIRA will end up with thousands of projects (ballpark figure of about 10,000 projects). However, it would appear that JIRA was not designed to scale to this number of projects and we would like to request some new features in JIRA to support this number of projects. 

These requests are based on our findings of running a JIRA instance with 12,000 projects (this was created using a modified version of your jmeter-test-setup.jmx performance testing script).

Feature Request 1:
Add pagination support to the 'View all Projects' page both under the Projects tab and the Administration page. 

As you can imagine, with 12,000 projects these pages take too long to load making project selection extremely difficult. Pagination would enable a user to browse a large number of projects without excessive load times.


Feature Request 2:
Add some filter controls on the 'View all Projects' page. 

Even with pagination, searching thousands of projects would be tedious. Thus if we could get filters, even if it were just a name based filter, that would be most welcome.


Regards,
  -George Clernon
fields.summary: Pagination and Filtering of Project Browser index pages when JIRA has thousands of projects

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a rich text field for writing additional Release Notes. Basically this means is that a user can enter details of Release (notes, special instructions, etc.) in this field and when someone clicks on Release Notes link in Change Log or Road Map, this description will show up followed by the current items which are tickets.

This will help Release Teams to snap out the actual Release Notes for customers and not type somewhere else. Like when support team is looking at the Change Log for some version they can have a quick look at the release notes there itself and know what special things/instructions are there for that release.

See the snapshot. perhaps that will explain it better.
fields.summary: Option to enter additional Release Notes

fields.description:
If you create custom roles for SCRUM, such as product owner, and scrum master, those roles should have the ability to update versions and components, since they are obviously involved in the architecting and release management.

However, in JIRA only an Administrator role has permissions to update versions and components, and in permission schemes, there is no way to assign versions and component related permissions to a roles. 

So the only way to allow this is to map product owners and scrum masters to the Adminstration role, but this effectively the same as making them an admin of project...which is not desired.

JIRA permissions schemes should support the specific mapping of version and component related permissions to roles so that a given project can allow a product owner or scrum master to update versions and components without having to be an admin of the project.
fields.summary: As a non-admin project member I should be able to update versions and components of my project.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a user with username "administrator"
# Login with username "administrator" and create a ticket A
# Configure a LDAP connector
# Inside the LDAP directory, create a username "Administrator"
# Make the LDAP directory at the top of the User Directories
# Create another ticket B
# Issue Navigator can only search for ticket B

There are also other errors like the user cannot see own issues, dashboard etc.

This error happens because JIRA is using the column *user_name* in the table *cwd_user* for all operations. JIRA should have used the column *lower_user_name*. For example, the table *jiraissue* is showing "Administrator" in the column *reporter* for ticket B.
fields.summary: JIRA using mixed-case username from LDAP corrupt other features
Show status of linked issue(s) in search (Issue Navigator )

fields.description:
While researching issues it is very difficult to scroll down pages in Firefox 4
if you drag the scroll bar down or roll the scroll wheel large amounts of empty space is created in the issue and the comments etc are pushed to the bottom of the page.

Disabling Javascript resolves this problem.

enabling/disabling firebug and friends has no effect the problem still occurs
fields.summary: Firefox 4 and the Issues
Upgrade task doesn't like Crowd servers with "services" in the hostname

fields.description: This happened during development of a custom field plugin. I imported and enabled the plugin, and when I loaded the Custom Fields page the tomcat logs showed a stack trace, as I had misconfigured the atlassian-plugin.xml file. The UI gave me to indication of this. Needless to say, my new custom field was not available when I tried to add it. I went back to check my plugin was enabled, and found it in a disabled state.
fields.summary: No error message shown for erroneous Custom Field Plugin

fields.description:
In Speakeasy, we have content in a view profile panel, and that has worked fine, until I tried to use dropdown.  I discovered the following bugs when the page is loaded with a different panel, but then the right one is switched to via a click (all works fine if the page is loaded with the desired panel selected):
# JavaScript is undebuggable.  It doesn't show up in firebug and even if I put "debugger;", it is ignored.  Even the error console has nothing.  I worked around this with heaps of console.log statements everywhere
# AJS.$ !== window.jQuery  This causes all sorts of pain, which I noticed once I tried to use an AUI dropdown, which puts the 'dropDown' function in the jQuery.fn namespace.  window.jQuery has it missing, although it is in AJS.$.  I worked around this by assigning AJS.$ = window.jQuery, then sticking the dropdown back in.
# Related to above, it seems a whole new copy of batch.js gets loaded (among other things), causing even things like the JIRA dropdowns to stop working correctly.
fields.summary: JavaScript using jQuery and/or AJS in view profile panels all sorts of broken in dev mode

fields.description:
Below is a copy/paste of our KB page regarding somehow unexpected behaviour of JavaMail. We should investigate and if possible disable the fall-back to localhost. 

h4. Symptoms
# Mail Servers page displays correctly user defined SMTP server (different from localhost)
# The following appears in the atlassian-jira.log:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: javax.mail.MessagingException: Could not connect to SMTP host: localhost, port: 25;
  nested exception is:
    java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
    at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:169)
    at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.mail.SendTestMail.doExecute(SendTestMail.java:93)
...
Caused by: javax.mail.MessagingException: Could not connect to SMTP host: localhost, port: 25;
  nested exception is:
    java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
    at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.openServer(SMTPTransport.java:1391)
...
{noformat}

h4. Cause

JavaMail library attempts to connect the server specified by user and on failure it defaults to localhost and port 25.


h4. Resolution

Ensure that valid Host Name and protocol parameters are specified in SMTP Mail Server section of Mail Servers page
fields.summary: Specified SMTP Configuration is Ignored and Application Uses localhost and Port 25

fields.description:
* Steps To Reproduce:
1) Using a Mac web browser, browse to a bug in JIRA.
2) Highlight text and hit Command + C(the typical hot-key for Copy on the Mac)

** Actual Result:
Highlighted text will be copied, and the process for creating an issue in JIRA will be started.

** Expected Result:
When text is highlight and the user hits a hot-key typically used for Copying, the user expects the text to copy to the clipboard instead of an Issue being created in JIRA.

** Additional Information (Setup/Notes/etc):
Not sure if this hot-key is used or not, but perhaps "Create Issue" could use the hot-key:
Command + I on the Mac
Ctrl + I on the PC
fields.summary: JIRA Create Issue hot-key interferes with Copy hot-key on the Mac

fields.description: Should be a way to move the subtasks up or down with a drag and drop feature instead of one row at a time. When there are an extensive amount of subtasks it is cumbersome and time consuming to move subtasks up or down one row at a time. Having a drag and drop feature would allow for quicker organization of the subtasks.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop Subtasks

fields.description:
It would be helpful to have an option to set Remaining Estimate to 0, rather than having to select "Set to" and enter 0.
Its not such a big deal to do that for a single story at a time, but is annoying when you're trying to update several stories in a row.

On a related note, it would also be nice to have a user setting that would allow you to default to "set to 0" rather than "adjust automatically" when resolving or closing an issue.


Related to case: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1993
fields.summary: Option to set the Remaining Estimated time to 0 when Resolving or Closing an issue
Improve on the way JIRA handles the Crowd Integration

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

    Invoke the label picker dialog.
    Type the text of a new label.
    Press the space key.

Result:

The new label is added, but the suggestion list remains unchanged. It shows one item "my-new-label (New Label)", which is useless since this label has already been added, and zero or more options for "my-new-label-1", "my-new-label-2", etc.

Expected result:

The suggestion list should either be closed or have its options reset to the same list that would be shown by pressing the down arrow key.
fields.summary: Label picker suggestions aren't dismissed after entering label with space key

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24529].
  {panel}

Unable to access Jira after setting an unauthorized account to run the tomcat service. The account had to be set to be allowed to run a service.

The message I got told me that the Jira was unable to clear the Felix cache in the osg.plugins directory. From the Atlassian docs I found on the net this message meant that perhaps there was something wrong with the network performance or perhaps there was more than one instance of jira or as it said in the doc "Confluense" ( Anyway a Atlassian prod ) pointing at the same HOME directory. This doc should be updated with the problem I have found or this specific problem should have it´s own more clear fail message.

After setting the permissions to run service for the account all was fine and OK.




Link to doc with the incomplete text:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=223219172

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24522].
  {panel}

Per [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow#ConfiguringWorkflow-Changingthenumberoftransitionbuttons] one has to edit the jira-application.properties file to modify the number of workflow transition that show on issue screens. This request is for the ability to modify this behavior in the admin UI.

It would also be beneficial if customers could change the Ops Bar Action icons in addition to the workflow transition buttons. I.E. be able to view 'clone' or 'attach files' as a button instead of in the list of it's a heavily used function.

 

*Note:* 
 # Modifications in the  {{jira-config.properties}} file is not supported in Cloud.
fields.summary: Allow Configuration of the Number of Workflow Transition Buttons Through the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24521].
  {panel}

A user can specify the sort order (latest first, oldest first) on the Comments tab. But somehow, JIRA loses this choice (logout maybe?).
The sort order can be set by an Admin, but not overruled by a user itself.

The wish here is to be able to remember the sort order on the useraccount setting.

Business context:
* managers like to see the most recent on top of the tab
* developers like to see the most recent at the bottom of the whole page
fields.summary: Sort order preference of Comments, Sources, etc is reset. Could be a user setting instead.

fields.description:
I have had several customers complaining when they fill in the option Support box on the https://www.endicia.com/Support/ Web page does not have an option for the user to carbon copy a copy of the message to his or her email address. Some issues are complex and need an audit trail and even if they don't, business customers and their employees appreciate and are sometimes required, to keep a copy of all correspondence.

Ideally an automatic email reply should automatically be send to the customers email account.  2nd option the user should be provided a checkbox for where s/he would prefer the copy of the message to be sent
fields.summary: Regarding Email Web Responses For Support

fields.description:
Here is a scenario:
- In a single JIRA project, we have two companies CompA and CompB creating support requests
- To isolate issues, the configured security levels are
-* "CompA" based on "group-CompA" + group "support",
-* "CompB" based on "group-CompB" + group "support",
-* and then "Support Team" on group "support" which is default

At issue creation, we would like the *required* security level field to be set based on the reporter, without additional action either from users or support team.

Here are trials done:
# If the "Security Level" field is not configured in creation screen
#- A ticket created by user "a1" in "group-CompA" has level "Support Team" (default)
#- The user "a1" cannot see its ticket immediately to comment or add a screenshot
# If we change default "Security Level" to "CompA" and the field is not available in creation screen
#- A ticket created by user "a1" in "group-CompA" has the correct level "CompA"
#- But a ticket created by user "b1" in "group-CompB" has the "CompA" level
# So we add "Security Level" in creation screen and set the default "Security Level" to "Support Team"
#- The user "a1" in "group-CompA" see a combo-box with current value "None" and the only available value "CompA"

Here are proposals:

* When the "Security Level" field is required and displayed with only one available option, it would be comfortable that the combo-box has selected value "CompA" and no "None" option.
This first point has limited consequences.

* When the field is not on creation screen, why not select the only "Security Level" available (as if displayed to the user) instead of using default one to avoid the effect the issue is no longer accessible ?
This second point may have other consequences but the behavior may be configurable.
fields.summary: JIRA should be able to select relevant Security Level at issue creation

fields.description:
PT Story Estimates are imported into the JIRA custom field Story Points. If Story Points is not present the importer will create it. If it is present due to GH being already installed, it will use the existing custom field. The problem is that GH creates that custom field as limited to Epic and Story issue types. So the importer generates lots of these errors:

ERROR - The scope of the custom field: 'Story Points' is not applicable to the issue: TEST-2.

A workaround is to make any existing custom field named Story Points applicable to all issue types.
fields.summary: Existing GH install causes errors for a PivotalTracker import

fields.description:
* JIRA 4.2.x and LDAP - The username in LDAP is _Jirauser_ and in JIRA is _jirauser_. The assignee field of the issues are set to _jirauser_. JIRA only authenticates the password, and it works. 
* Upgrade to JIRA 4.3.x and create a _Connector_ directory for user management. The _Jirauser_ in LDAP is now the _Jirauser_ in JIRA as well. 
* If you click on an issue where the assignee was user _jirauser_, the assignee is now the _Jirauser_, and the user can perform the assignee actions, however, this issue does not show up under the _Assign to Me_ gadget or the Issue navigator when you perform a seach for *Assignee = Jirauser*. The field _lower_user_name_ of table *cwd_user* is not being used for all the necessary fields in JIRA.
fields.summary: Migration for JIRA 4.3 using a "Microsoft Active Directory" with usernames with mixcases causes ownership problems
JQL - When using 'NOT IN()' for custom fields and labels results should include EMPTY

fields.description:
Steps to replicate the problem:
* In any of the fields that uses autocomplete render such as Components populate with long list of values
* Append the field on iframes such as resolve issue screen
* Try to resolve issues and choose a value from the fields.
* The scroll bar will appear but not working correctly.
* In JIRA 4.2.x, it works when you click on the arrows at the top/bottom
* In JIRA 4.3.x, it is not just possible to scroll.

See screen shot for more details.

*This is not affecting IE9 browser that is used to access JIRA 5.2.x*
fields.summary: Vertical scroll bar does not work on IE browsers when viewing fields with autocomplete renderers in dialogs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24507].
  {panel}

Some customers don't have any longer a need for Crowd as the new user management framework (JIRA 4.3+) is sufficient for their needs.

They would benefit from an import tool that allows import users & groups to JIRA. 

Tool that would work similar to the Crowd importer, but the other way around.

!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/30736459/Import+-+JIRA.png?version=1&modificationDate=1203400551966!

For users with programming experience a possible workaround is to use Crowd's REST API for the export and JIRA's API for the import.
fields.summary: Create Crowd users importer to JIRA
Most users won't be able to generate thread dumps on window with help of our doco

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-24505].
  {panel}

As of JIRA 4.3 the application is able to generate thread dumps on some predefined events. This work was done as [JRA-15470|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15470].

Support would really benefit from streamlining the process of generating thread dumps. Current process to some extend is to difficult to follow for inexperienced users.

Following Confluence we could implement simple UI similar to:

!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/188095/confluence-3-0-thread-dump-generation.png?version=1&modificationDate=1243657619810!

and similar scheduling:
!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/188095/confluence-3-0-thread-dump-scheduling.png?version=1&modificationDate=1243657618019!
fields.summary: Abilty to generate thread dumps from  UI

fields.description:
Following step is possible and ends up in a problem prone behaviour of complete JIRA (affects filters, activity streams and gadgets).

In screenshot 1 you see a due date that is formed "20011-03-11"(the year contains one zero to many!) which is entered manually, not by the date picker mask.

This ONE ticket containing an date with a wrong date format affects almost *ANYTHING* within JIRA using the attribute with this wrong date (in my case the due date):

* See [screenshot 2|^screenshot_2.png] of all calenders displaying issues regarding their due date
* see [screenshot 3|^screenshot_3.png] of the trial to display a filter being order by the due date

We really searched a very long time to identify the reason for the strange behaviour of our JIRA!! 
After correcting the due date JIRA must be reindexed to get rid of the issue!
fields.summary: Weak plausibility check for entering dates  (e.g. due) can end up in huge problems with filters, activity streams and gadgets

fields.description:
In JIRA 4.3.3 I imported an XML backup from 4.2.3 where LDAP was working using osuser.xml. The osuser.xml was copied to the new 4.3.3 install and the import went fine.
But when I log in as an internal user and try to edit the new "JIRA Delegated Authentication Directory" it takes me to the URL:

http://10.30.15.102:8080/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/delegatingldap/?xsrfTokenName=atl_token&xsrfTokenValue=4b7f1b83af1af7a065171d999932119f77fdc070&directoryId=3

which produces an error

Request processing failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.FatalBeanException: Could not copy properties from source to target; nested exception is java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

Referer URL: http://10.30.15.102:8080/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/list


Interestingly if I change the directoryId parameter from 3 to 1 everything appears to work properly.
fields.summary: Editing the automatically created JIRA Delegated Authentication Directory raises an exception

fields.description:
When choosing the columns to display for the JIRA Filter Results gadget from the listbox, clicking the area above or below the marker, but not on the arrow buttons, only moves the list up or down on line at a time.

*Steps to reproduce*:

# Place a Filter Results Gadget
# Go to select the Fields to display.
# Use your mouse to scroll the list of columns. The arrow buttons at the top and bottom of the scroll bar move 1 line at a time, as they should. Now click in the area inside those array buttons (but not in the marker/dragger) and it should move up/down a page at a time. It only moves 1 line.

****Even Google Chrome 11 is not supported yet, this info can be useful in future releases****
fields.summary: Scroll doesn't behave correctly when using Chrome

fields.description:
Hello,

Usually our users append comments to a Jira Issue directly sending an e-mail, or answering to the e-mail report.
In the case they answer to my comments, the e-mail they send contains the original message (i.e. my comment) in the body. As result, every comment of a user contains also my comment, and in the end the Jira Issue becomes very long, with useless replication of information.

I would suggest to implement a mechanism that automatically hides the content of a comment following the {{----Original Message----}}.

kind regards,

Marco Boccioli
fields.summary: Hide original message when the comment comes from an e-mail
